abstract.p: Ad Hoc Softwares, which sells eclectic designer linens and accessories for bed and bath, moves to new location in Lower Manhattan (S)

block.p: Ad Hoc Softwares, a well-known West Broadway emporium filled with eclectic designer linens and accessories for bed and bath, is moving to a new location at 136 Wooster Street. Beginning today, the owners, Julia McFarlane and Judy Auchincloss, are selling their wares at large discounts. They promise immediate savings of 25 percent to 50 percent on all merchandise, with discounts increasing each week until the West Broadway store closes on June 12.

Ad Hoc Softwares, a well-known West Broadway emporium filled with eclectic designer linens and accessories for bed and bath, is moving to a new location at 136 Wooster Street. Beginning today, the owners, Julia McFarlane and Judy Auchincloss, are selling their wares at large discounts. They promise immediate savings of 25 percent to 50 percent on all merchandise, with discounts increasing each week until the West Broadway store closes on June 12.

Linen duvet covers that were $295 are now $147. Cotton sheets that were $155 are now $77.50. Throws and blankets are also on sale; a king-size alpaca blanket that was $785 is now $392, and English wool throws that were $300 are $150. The classic chrome Bullet trash can was $395 but will now be $275. The store fixtures are for sale, too. Ad Hoc Softwares' current location is 410 West Broadway (at Spring Street); it will reopen on Wooster Street at the end of June.
